en.title: Ansible – Lesson 11: Roles
en.subtitle: Understanding what roles are, why they are used, and how to structure projects using roles

sections.heading: 1. What is a Role in Ansible?
sections.content: A role is a structured way of organizing playbooks, tasks, variables, files and templates to make automation reusable and clean.

sections.heading: 2. Why Use Roles?
sections.content: Roles help in reusing code, improving readability, maintaining large projects easily and following best practices.

sections.heading: 3. When to Use Roles?
sections.content: Roles are used when your playbooks become large, complex and need reusability across multiple projects.

sections.heading: 4. Default Role Directory Structure
sections.content: Each role has directories like tasks, handlers, files, templates, vars, defaults, meta.

sections.heading: 5. Main Files Inside Roles
sections.content: Important files are: tasks/main.yml, handlers/main.yml, vars/main.yml, defaults/main.yml.

sections.heading: 6. tasks/main.yml
sections.content: This file contains the main set of tasks that the role will execute.

sections.heading: 7. vars vs defaults
sections.content: Vars have higher priority than defaults. Defaults are used to provide basic values that users can override.

sections.heading: 8. files & templates Folder
sections.content: Files folder holds static files. Templates folder holds Jinja2 template files.

sections.heading: 9. Including a Role in Playbook
sections.content: Roles are included using the roles keyword inside a playbook.

sections.heading: 10. Example Role Usage
sections.content: Example: roles: - nginx - docker

sections.heading: 11. Advantages of Roles
sections.content: Better organization, easy reuse, cleaner playbooks, team collaboration support.

sections.heading: 12. Real-Time Use Case
sections.content: In real projects, each service like nginx, mysql, java, docker is maintained as a separate role.

sections.heading: Lesson 11 Summary
sections.content: You learned what roles are, their structure, how to use them and why they are important in large Ansible projects.
